column6: Translating and integrating theory and scientific evidence into the clinical work of the advanced practice clinical scholar is the focus of this second seminar course. Culturally-aware approaches are developed to resolve a healthcare issue using theoretic models and principles of evidence-based practice to design innovative interventions. Comprised of 2 didactic content hours per week and a clinical practicum of 14 hours per week.

column2: ADVANCED LEADERSHIP IN HEALTHCARE
column4: doctoral standing.
column6: Advanced competencies of the doctoral-prepared advanced practice nurse for transformational leadership in healthcare to improve patient and population health outcomes are addressed. Five key leadership competencies including creating and leading change; self-knowledge; strategic vision; interpersonal communication; and organizational effectiveness are presented with examples and case studies. Transcending themes of ethics, research, inter-professional collaboration, creativity, and insuring accountability are addressed throughout the course. Students conduct a self-assessment, and develop and implement individualized action plans for advanced competency in inter-professional healthcare leadership.

column2: CLINICAL SCHOLAR PRACTICUM
column4: NURS 70610; and doctoral standing; and special approval.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Synthesis of components of clinical scholar leader role comprises this practicum. Students apply advanced leadership and clinical scholarship skills to developing and evaluating approaches to healthcare problems in a practicum setting.

column2: FOUNDATIONS OF RESEARCH METHODS IN NURSING
column6: Examines diverse paradigms and research methods as the foundation for scholarly inquiry in nursing knowledge development. Students begin building a foundation for focused intellectual inquiry in a substantive area of nursing. Pre- or corequisite: NURS 70710 and doctoral standing.

column2: HISTORY AND PHILOSOPHY OF NURSING SCIENCE
column4: Doctoral standing and special approval.
column6: This course examines the nature and metaphysics and epistemology and the influence of contemporary Eastern and Western philosophies on the developing epistemology of disciplinary nursing knowledge.

column2: THEORY CONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT IN NURSING
column4: NURS 70710 and doctoral standing.
column6: This course examines strategies for theory development including logical-empirical-deductive and inductive approaches. Emphasis will be on elements and strategies used in theory building.

column2: INTRODUCTION TO NURSING KNOWLEDGE DOMAINS
column4: Doctoral standing or special approval from Department. Pre- or corequisite: NURS 70715.
column6: Introductory seminar analyzing selected theoretical and methodological approaches to knowledge development in nursing. Emphasis on critical analysis of knowledge in areas of special interest.

column2: QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH METHODS IN NURSING
column6: Extends students' knowledge of the theory and practice of quantitative research in nursing. Focus is on the major types of quantitative design in nursing science. Theoretical and procedural issues related to design, measurement and data management with a substantive area of nursing inquiry are emphasized. Akron 8200: 825. Pre- or Corequisites: NURS 70705 and 70727 and doctoral standing.

column2: ADVANCED HEALTH CARE STATISTICS I
column4: Doctoral standing.
column6: Comprehension of bivariate and multivariate descriptive and inferential statistics designed for nurse researchers. Applications to research problems in nursing. Akron 8200 827.

column2: QUALITATIVE RESEARCH METHODS IN NURSING
column4: Doctoral standing.
column6: Selected qualitative research methods used to study nursing phenomena. Philosophical bases; design, data collection and analysis; evaluation of rigor; and ethical issues for major qualitative methods will be analyzed with regard to nursing phenomena.

column2: NURSING AND HEALTH CARE POLICY
column4: Doctoral standing and special approval.
column6: Critical examination of theories and processes of formulating state/national health care policy. Focus on health issues, the political and legislative process and contemporary policy dilemmas.

column2: ADVANCED HEALTH CARE STATISTICS II
column4: NURS 70727 and doctoral standing or special approval from department.
column6: Application of bivariate and multivariate descriptive and inferential statistics to research problems in nursing. Akron 8200 837.

column2: ADVANCED TOPICS IN QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH METHODS
column4: NURS 70725 and 70727 and doctoral standing. Pre- or corequisite: NURS 70737.
column6: Focuses on integration and application of components of quantitative research design in nursing through application of multivariate design principles to existing data sets. Advanced topics in methods, statistics and measurement are addressed.

column2: ADVANCED METHODS FOR NURSING RESEARCH: MEASUREMENT IN NURSING
column4: NURS 70720 and NURS 70725; and doctoral standing; or special approval from department.
column6: Theories and concepts related to measurement and nursing research including techniques for construction, testing and refining of instruments with assessment of reliability and validity.

column2: ADVANCED METHODS FOR NURSING RESEARCH: APPLICATION OF QUALITATIVE METHODS
column4: NURS 70720 and NURS 70725 and NURS 70730. Doctoral standing.
column6: Theory, data collection and analysis used in qualitative nursing research with a focus on phenomenology, grounded theory and ethnography.

column2: ADVANCED METHODS FOR NURSING RESEARCH: GRANT DEVELOPMENT AND FUNDING
column4: Doctoral standing or special approval from department; and NURS 70720.
column6: Advanced seminar on critical analysis of proposal and grant development, funding, peer review and advocacy process with emphasis on the development of a grant proposal.

column2: SPECIAL TOPICS IN NURSING
column4: Doctoral standing.
column6: (Repeatable for credit)Study of important topics in nursing practice, research on the profession. Offering in response to existing interests and opportunities.

column2: INDIVIDUAL INVESTIGATION IN NURSING
column4: Doctoral standing.
column6: (Repeatable for credit)Individual enrollment for independent study in nursing carried out by student under supervision of a doctoral faculty member.

column2: RESEARCH IN NURSING
column4: Doctoral standing.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Research carried out by a student under faculty supervision. In-depth inquiry should result in a paper or appropriate product.

column2: CAPSTONE PROJECT I
column4: NURS 70600; and doctoral standing; and special approval. Pre- or
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Faculty and preceptor-directed project that contributes to nursing practice knowledge. Culminates in an oral defense and a publishable manuscript. Students register for a total of 6 hours, 2 to 6 hours in a single semester, distributed over three semesters if desired.

column2: CAPSTONE PROJECT II
column4: NURS 76199; and doctoral standing; and special approval.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Capstone project students must continue registration until all degree Requirements are met.

column2: DISSERTATION I
column4: doctoral standing and admission to doctoral candidacy.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Independent doctoral research for the dissertation under faculty supervision. Registration of at least two semesters is require, continuing until completion of 30 credit hours. Akron 8200: 899.

column2: VARIABLE CONTENT SEMINAR IN NURSING: NURSING SCIENCE I
column4: NURS 70720.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Seminar on in-depth analysis, synthesis and evaluation of one substantive area within nursing and related disciplines focusing on the generation and dissemination of nursing knowledge. Akron 8200: 840.

column2: VARIABLE CONTENT SEMINAR IN NURSING: NURSING SCIENCE II
column4: NURS 86091.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) In-depth focused analysis and synthesis of a substantive area relevant to the student's specific research focus, culminating in a written product for dissemination.
